channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ukraine Launches Rare Cross-Border Ground Assault Into Russia, Kremlin Says
item.description: Troops and armored fighting vehicles crossed into Russia’s western Kursk region on Tuesday, according to Moscow and independent analysts. Ukrainian officials have not commented.

item.title: Fear Stalks Israel’s Communities on the Front Lines With Lebanon
item.description: As tensions again escalate with Hezbollah, Israelis face the prospect of another “lost year” in the evacuated north.

item.title: Hyundai and Kia cars targeted by TikTok thieves see theft rates drop by over half after software updates
item.description: Theft rates of the affected automobiles soared after thieves discovered that certain car models lacked engine immobilizers, an anti-theft technology that has long been standard in other vehicles.

item.title: Wesley Bell Defeats Cori Bush, a ‘Squad’ Member and Vocal Critic of Israel
item.description: Her defeat is another loss for progressives in a race defined by Democratic divisions over the war in Gaza, with pro-Israel groups pouring millions into a campaign to oust her from office.

item.title: How Belarus Was Left Out of a Prisoner Swap Between Russia and the West
item.description: While Belarus played a role in the sweeping prisoner exchange last week, none of the 1,400 people classified as political prisoners in the country by a human rights group were freed.

item.title: Airline offers women the choice of not sitting next to men when they book seats
item.description: India's biggest domestic airline IndiGo has had a great reaction to its policy says CEO Pieter Elbers.

item.title: Fear Stalks Israel’s Communities on the Front Lines With Lebanon
item.description: As tensions again escalate with Hezbollah, Israelis face the prospect of another “lost year” in the evacuated north.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Appointment of New Hamas Leader Casts Further Doubt on Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: The choice of Yahya Sinwar, who is taking over as the armed group’s political leader after the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, is a sign of defiance against Israel, analysts say.

item.title: Bosses are losing the ‘return-to-office’ war as the WFH pyjama army forces them to go hybrid
item.description: Despite all the noise around bosses ditching remote working for good, the world's largest hybrid workspace provider just reported record revenue.

item.title: How Belarus Was Left Out of a Prisoner Swap Between Russia and the West
item.description: While Belarus played a role in the sweeping prisoner exchange last week, none of the 1,400 people classified as political prisoners in the country by a human rights group were freed.

item.title: Riots Break Out Across UK: What to Know
item.description: The country was bracing for more unrest, with fresh protests planned after a weekend of demonstrations turned into anti-immigrant riots.

item.title: DBS’s next CEO will be Tan Su Shan, the first woman to lead Southeast Asia’s largest bank
item.description: Tan Su Shan will become the first woman CEO in DBS' history when she assumes the top job come March 2025.

item.title: Riots Break Out Across UK: What to Know
item.description: The country was bracing for more unrest, with fresh protests planned after a weekend of demonstrations turned into anti-immigrant riots.

item.title: Ukraine Launches Rare Cross-Border Ground Assault Into Russia, Kremlin Says
item.description: Troops and armored fighting vehicles crossed into Russia’s western Kursk region on Tuesday, according to Moscow and independent analysts. Ukrainian officials have not commented.

item.title: Elon Musk’s backing of Donald Trump is hurting Tesla’s struggling EV business in Europe
item.description: German drugstore chain Rossmann said that Elon Musk's support for Donald Trump, the Republican candidate who calls climate change a hoax, goes against Tesla's mission—and it wants out.
